channel.title: Recipes on flynn's site
channel.description: Recent content in Recipes on flynn's site

item.title: Quick pizza dough
item.description: Inspired somewhat by this New York Times recipe, this is my go-to recipe for when I want pizza in under an hour. Roberta’s is still my favorite dough overall if you have an afternoon. Ingredients (per ~12” pizza): 200g 00 pizza flour (all purpose can be substituted) 125g warm water 25g oliveoil 5g salt 2g yeast Procedure: Combine ingredients and knead thoroughly, until almost smooth, about 5 minutes.

item.title: My sourdough recipe
item.description: This 75% hydration 15% whole wheat loaf draws from a mix of this King Arthur recipe and Ken Forkish’s Flour Water Salt Yeast. Ingredients: 500g 100% hydration starter (e.g.) 600g all purpose flour (I use King Arthur flours) 150g whole wheat flour 500g room temperature water 22g salt Procedure: Feed starter 4-8 hours before mixing—if starter is kept in a mason jar, it should be just about overflowing.

item.title: Dear Abby Cake
item.description: Cake Makes two moist and chocolatey 8” cake layers. Ingredients 3 oz. unsweetened chocolate (total 4 oz.) 1⁄2 cup butter (total 9 tbsp.) 1 cup water 2 cups cake flour (sifted) 1.25 tsp. baking soda 1 tsp. salt 2 eggs (total 5) 1 cup (8 oz.) sour cream 2 cups sugar (total 3 cups) 1.5 tsp. vanilla (total 3 tsp.) Procedure Preheat oven to 350 F. Melt 3 oz.
